column4: Hi, will ubuntu run on a Packard Bell EasyNote BG48-U-200 laptop?
I don't mean "power", I mean "support" or "drivers"...
if you need a GUI environment, there's always something like "xubuntu" that's a little lighter, or you can use the "server" configuration that has no GUI, and i am sure it will run fine
That laptop is just as powerfull as my home PC, but I want to know if the hardware is suppott
